meanings.definition: A person who habitually sees or anticipates the worst or is disposed to be gloomy.
meanings.sent1: Some pessimists always expect bad things to happen.
meanings.sent2: Many people consider pessimists to be too negative.
meanings.sent3: The group of pessimists joked about the sun never shining again.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the dark clouds symbolized the pessimists' outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The image of the stormy sea stuck in his mind, like the pessimists' constant fear of disaster.

meanings.definition: One who holds a gloomy or negative view of life.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a pessimists, always expecting the worst.
meanings.sent2: The pessimists in the room couldn't see any silver lining.
meanings.sent3: Despite his pessimistic nature, he found humor in dark jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a dark cave, echoing the thoughts of the pessimists.
meanings.sent5: The pessimists' shadow loomed over the cheerful gathering, casting a gloomy atmosphere.
